issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Â 

Add a force option to DiskBalancer Execute command, which is used for skip date check and force execute the plan.

This is one of the TODO for diskbalancer.
fields.summary: Disk Balancer: Add skipDateCheck option to DiskBalancer Execute command

comments.body: In testcases, added force flag in one of the test case to check, if it is taking the argument or not.

I am +1 on this change (completely agree with renamining force to skipDateCheck, see [~arpitagarwal]'s comment).

I have a minor suggestion: Not that it helps, but just to make myself feel better, would you please add a warning that says something like :

{{"Skipping date check on this plan. This could mean we are executing an old plan and may not be the right plan for this data node."}} or something to that effect.Â 

This might mean you will need the if check as in the original code or you can add that warning inside {{submitPlan}} code too.

nit: datecheckÂ  ==> "date check" (ExecuteCommand.java:Line 52) 

Â
